div.p: A normal working day at the minute we do shifts so we do 2 days, 2 nights; the daytime will be 9:00-6:00 and the night shifts will be 6:00-9:00
so 6pm until 9am in the morning. A day shift you come in in the morning, remember at any time you could be called out, but the morning shift
you do a roll call make sure everyone’s on shift, by half past you do your checks, we check our trucks and make sure we’ve got all our equipment
it’s all up-to-scratch and everything’s clean, come half past nine we do a drill which is basically a practice drill so we could do anything from
you know pretending there was a house fire, putting our breathing apparatus on, doing ladder drills, pumping drills,
anything to do with our jobs basically to keep our skills up. That takes us up to the afternoon, just before the afternoon we have
a little fitness regime programme going so for an hour do some fitness, do the gym, do some circuits, some cardio, not too much weights
but it depends on the individual themselves. Then we break off for lunch, after lunch that’s when we start to go out to either do a risk visit
to a building, see what the risks are involved or go to people’s homes, give them fire safety advice that’s what we do for a whole day.
